heisig_chinese_memo: Bambi (the Disney deer) wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what's the main course?
heisig_constituent: deer, cave, antlers, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2
heisig_story: Drawn on the walls of a complex of caves near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of deer, some of them showing men in deer masks. By comparing their drawings to real deer, Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt; and by comparing themselves to the deer, to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a "double-key" (the extra stroke through the element for key) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which caves, a double-key, and comparing gives us the kanji for deer.
koohiiStory1: Bambi wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what¬¥s the main course?
koohiiStory2: Santa¬¥s reindeer, Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a cave. It¬¥s popular with all the deer and reindeer in the world. The cave speciality is a salad w/ dressing on the side. There is no other deer club that can compare. How many other deer nightclubs are there?

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A canopy and a helicopter are being compared by a deer. The deer is standing very still (as deer do) and looking very slowly between the empty canopy and the helicopter sitting next to it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the deer comparing the two structures. It probably has no idea what they are, but it's trying very hard to understand what it's seeing anyway.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You walk forward, about to call out to the deer, when a car („Åã) suddenly appears out of no where and runs the deer over! Was this all just a trap set up to murder the deer?!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Deer get hit by cars all the time, but it was still really shocking . I mean it was right in front of you. The car could have hit you too!

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Bambi (the Disney deer) wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what's the main course?
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The shape of a deer when viewed from the side by a golden inscription, emphasizing the bifurcated horns of a deer. The original meaning is deer. The oracle bone " deer " has two horns on the top and four legs on the bottom, or a horn or two legs. "Shuowen": "Deer, beast. Elephant head, horns, four-legged shape. Birds and deer feet are similar, from the dagger. Every deer belongs to the deer." , The two corners of the Warring States characters are gradually simplified, like a corner, which is similar to the upper part of the unicorner "Âªå". See "Âªå". In the Warring States Period, the lower part of the character " Deer " was written in the form of two feet opposite each other.

The character " deer " in Jiajin inscription is used as the original meaning. "Collection" 10410: "Only (get) five deer", refers to the capture of five deer. Also "Collection" 10265: "Compete with the deer." Life: "Wang Yi (given) the deer", the king gave the life a deer. Racoon: "The king ordered the scholar to return to the raccoon deer." That is, the king ordered the scholar to gift three deer to the raccoon.

The " deer " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period can be read as " slaughter ". Jian 41 of "Rongcheng Family" has the term "dead deer (slaughter) clan", which refers to the elimination of ancestors and the killing of families.

" Deer " is mostly used as the original meaning in ancient books handed down, and only sometimes used as a metaphor for political power or title. "Historical Records. "Huaiyin Marquis Biography": "Qin loses its deer, and the world is chasing it." Pei Qi's "Ji Jie" quoted Zhang Yan: "The deer is used as the emperor." According to the original meaning of "Chasing the deer", the meaning of the latter is extended to chase the deer. Power, so the " deer " can be compared to the position of power. Today, "rivaling the deer in the Central Plains" is still used as a metaphor for the battle for the world.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The shape of a deer when viewed from the side by a golden inscription on the inscription, emphasizing the bifurcated horns of a deer. The original meaning is deer.

Heisig: Drawn on the walls of a complex of caves near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of deer, some of them showing men in deer masks. By comparing their drawings to real deer, Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt; and by comparing themselves to the deer, to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a "double-key" (the extra stroke through the element for key) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which caves, a double-key, and comparing gives us the kanji for deer.
* As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated much the same as the tiger was: the lower element is dropped to leave room for a replacement. Its meaning, however, remains the same. There are a very few cases (see frame 2158) in which there is no abbreviation. When this happens, we may keep the image suggested by the above explanation: painting of a deer.

Ôºö1„ÄÅÈπøÁßëÂä®Áâ©ÁöÑÊÄªÁß∞Ôºõ2„ÄÅÊØîÂñªÊîøÊùÉ„ÄÅÁàµ‰Ωç„ÄÇ

deer
Basic explanation of words
deer
l√π
Mammals with slender limbs and short tail. The stag has branch-like horns on its head. The hair is mostly brown, and some have variegation or stripes. Hearing and smell are very sensitive. There are many types, common sika deer, sambar, white-lipped deer, red deer and so on.
Square granary: "There is no red rice in the city, and the deer is empty."
Coarse, crude: Lu Qiu. Deer cloth. Deer bed.
name.
deer
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªl√πÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Lu Guqi, enter the house, come. ]
(1) Generic term for deer family mammals. The limbs are slender and the tail is short. Males usually have horns on their heads. Females of certain species also have horns. There are also males and females without horns. The hair is mostly brown, and some have variegation or stripes, and the sense of hearing and smell is very sensitive. There are many species in our country, including musk deer, deer, sambar, sika deer, white-lipped deer, red deer, elk, moose, reindeer, roe deer, noodles and so on.
(2) A metaphor for political power or title.
(3) A metaphor for a person in power.
(4) Crude; crude. See "Deer cloth".
(5) Granary.
(6) Through "Lu". Foot of the mountain.
(7) It means "corner (ju√©)". Ancient wine vessel.
(8) Use the same "record". See "Lulu".
(9) Use the same "Roll". See "Deer".
(10) Last name. In the Han Dynasty, there was the prefect deer banner of Ba County, and the later Wei Dynasty had the deer flag of Huangmen. Refer to Volume Three of "Surname Solution".

Radicals: Âπø, Ë¶Ä, ÊØî  (canopy, helicopter, compare)
Meaning Mnemonic
A canopy and a helicopter are being compared by a deer. The deer is standing very still (as deer do) and looking very slowly between the empty canopy and the helicopter sitting next to it.
Picture the deer comparing the two structures. It probably has no idea what they are, but it's trying very hard to understand what it's seeing anyway.
Reading Mnemonic
You walk forward, about to call out to the deer, when a car („Åã) suddenly appears out of no where and runs the deer over! Was this all just a trap set up to murder the deer?!
